parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Waypoints

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Defines the time between condition satisfaction and waypoint finish (randomly from min to max, with an average value mid).

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> waypoint '''setWaypointTimeout''' [min, mid, max]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> waypoint: [[Array]] - format [[Waypoint]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [min, mid, max]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> min: [[Number]]
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> mid: [[Number]]
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> max: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[_grp, 2] [[setWaypointTimeout]] [5, 10, 6];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[waypoints]], [[deleteWaypoint]], [[copyWaypoints]], [[setCurrentWaypoint]], [[setWaypointBehaviour]], [[setWaypointCombatMode]], [[setWaypointCompletionRadius]], [[setWaypointDescription]], [[setWaypointFormation]], [[setWaypointHousePosition]], [[setWaypointPosition]], [[setWaypointScript]], [[setWaypointSpeed]], [[setWaypointStatements]], [[setWaypointType]], [[setWaypointVisible]], [[waypointAttachVehicle]], [[waypointAttachedVehicle]], [[setWaypointLoiterRadius]], [[waypointLoiterRadius]], [[addWaypoint]], [[setWaypointLoiterType]], [[waypointTimeoutCurrent]], [[waypointSpeed]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 00:32, 12 December 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lucky44|Lucky44]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The example doesn't seem to make sense, according to the listed syntax. It seems to set a Max time greater than the Mid time.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on  03:30, 12 December 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tom 48 97|Tom 48 97]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
If mid is greater than max, the result will be really near the mid value.
Results with the values of the example: 8.237, 9.383, 10.425, 9.417, 9.43401, 10.425, 9.90601, 9.96701, 9.42401, 9.42502, 9.96698, 9.89999...
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
